instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no light on charger. No liquid exposure visible, where do i start? Ive already pulled the board-view for it if that helps. Thanks in advance

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message: wich board is this??? First start with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, voltage in both...

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 31601"]wich board is this??? First start with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, voltage in both...[/QUOTE]
[h=1]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board, and <SIGNAL>PP2V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V , PPBUS-G3H 0.04V[/h]

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message: 3V42 is the first thing you need. Voltages on <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>? Check for short to GND on 3V42.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 31656"]3V42 is the first thing you need. Voltages on <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>? Check for short to GND on 3V42.[/QUOTE]

Hi dukefawks, <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> Voltage - 16.55V PP3V42 Short to Ground.

threads.title: MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Won't power on, no green or orange light on charger
threads.message: Inject voltage on 3V42 rail and see what heats up.
